body.p: To replicate data to an established destination cluster from a source cluster, you can use the REST API or Couchbase Web Console. Once you create a replication it will automatically begin between the clusters. As a REST call:

codeblock.codeph: curl -v -X POST -u admin:password1 http://10.4.2.4:8091/controller/createReplication -d uuid=9eee38236f3bf28406920213d93981a3 -d fromBucket=beer-sample -d toCluster=remote1 -d toBucket=remote_beer -d replicationType=continuous

body.p: Replace the admin, password1, 10.4.2.4, 9eee38236f3bf28406920213d93981a3, beer-sample, remote1, remote_beer, and continuous values in the above example with your actual values.
This will send a request similar to the following example:

codeblock.codeph: POST / HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Basic QWRtaW5pc3RyYXRvcjpwYXNzd29yZDE= User-Agent: curl/7.21.4 (universal-apple-darwin11.0) libcurl/7.21.4 OpenSSL/0.9.8r zlib/1.2.5 Host: 10.4.2.4:8091 Accept: */* Content-Length: 126 Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

body.p: If Couchbase Server successfully creates the replication, it will immediately begin replicating data from the source to destination cluster. You will get a response similar to the following JSON:
The unique document ID returned in the JSON is a reference you can use if you want to delete the replication.
